As I understand the spec, you can cache authenticated=
 responses, if the
public directive is set. Which isn't useful for the page=
 itself, but
might be for parts of the page that are loaded dynamically.

I=
've never seen the domain feature of authentication work, so everyone
authe=
nticates the whole domain, but this might help to have caching for
parts th=
at can be cached.

But the point was more directed at cookies: if cookies a=
re present, the
response isn't cacheable.

-- 
Cheers,

Berend de Boer
